Name: Establishment of an office of sexual and reproductive health within the New York city department of health and mental hygiene.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of an office of sexual and reproductive health within the New York city department of health and mental hygiene

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Summary: This bill would create an office of sexual and reproductive health within DOHMH. Such office would be required to provide outreach, education, and support to adults and adolescents, especially low-income individuals and those without health insurance, regarding issues related to sexual and reproductive health, including but not limited to: contraception, including a broad range of methods such as long-acting reversible contraception; preconception health services; abortion services; family planning services; counseling and testing for HIV; testing and treatment for sexually transmitted infections; routine screening for breast and cervical cancer; and health education in community settings to promote reproductive health, to prevent unintended pregnancy, and to promote access to reproductive and preventive health services. The office would also make referrals to affordable and accessible services related to contraception, abortion, family planning, breast and cervical cancer screenings, and counseling, testing, and treatment for HIV and sexually transmitted infections, and conduct research on sexual and reproductive health disparities across New York City.

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. \cf1 Chapter 1 of title 17 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 17-199.19 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a7 17-199.19 Office of sexual and reproductive health. a. \cf0 The department shall establish \cf1 an office of sexual and reproductive health. Such office shall have the power and duty to:\par
 1. Provide outreach, education, and support to adults, and adolescents, especially low-income individuals and those without health insurance, regarding issues related to sexual and reproductive health, including but not limited to:\par
(a) Contraception, including a broad range of methods such as long-acting reversible contraception;\par
(b) Preconception health services;\par
(c) Abortion services;\par
(d) Family planning services;\par
(e) Counseling and testing for HIV;\par
(f) Testing and treatment for sexually transmitted infections;\par
(g) Routine screening for breast and cervical cancer; and\par
(h) Health education in community settings to promote reproductive health, to prevent unintended pregnancy, and to promote access to reproductive and preventive health services. \par
2. Make referrals to affordable and accessible services related to contraception, abortion, family planning, breast and cervical cancer screenings, and counseling, testing, and treatment for HIV and sexually transmitted infections.\par
3. Conduct research on sexual and reproductive health disparities across New York city.\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect 1 year after it becomes law.\par
